results.title: Midas
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Isabel Perez and Niki Bern
results.brief_description: ‘Midas’ is a retelling of the story of King Midas and the Golden Touch. It is told from the perspective of the narrator who read the tale over and over again as a child. The film begins brightly but becomes darker as some of the narration’s unspoken implications are revealed. Narrated by Zoe Carides.

results.title: Little echo lost
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Jane Keneally and Armagan Ballantyne
results.brief_description: The EchoMan has never questioned his existence till now. One day he witnesses an event that brings into question everything he stands for and believes in. Stars Hugo Weaving as the EchoMan and Alana de Roma as the young girl. Original format 35mm.

results.title: Flux
results.brief_description:
A film about trust, about an accident, about falling out of love and about emerging from grief. Flux was created entirely on a desktop Macintosh using Adobe AfterEffects and Adobe Photoshop. It was then transferred to 35mm film using a Solitair Film Recorder. It is listed by Lynden Barber (film critic for The Australian newspaper) as one of ‘12 Film Breakthroughs’ for its achievement as the first Australian film post-produced entirely on a home computer.
WARNING: This film contains scenes that may disturb some viewers.

results.title: Dusty hearts
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Mariel Beros and Pauline Chan
results.brief_description: Sax Elthan is a hapless musician, a refugee from the inner city. Rejected by his girlfriend, he travels to the outback to look for work. One burning Wednesday he finds himself beside a highway, waiting for a lift, contemplating his future. It arrives in the shape of a beat-up Volkswagon with a wardrobe tied to the roof. A black comedy about one man’s destiny starring Geoff Morrell (Blue Heelers, Changi). Also features Tina Bursill.

results.title: Bound
results.creator_credit: Daniella Ortega, Serhat Caradee and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A boy, a dead body, a relentless pursuit – it’s not what you see, it’s how you see it.
Bound is an urban tragedy about a boy who is mistakenly shot by the police. Jumping back and forth in time to reveal instincts colliding and lives unravelling in a world that rushes on regardless, this film is about what happens when you make all the wrong decisions for the right reasons.

results.title: Redfern Beach
results.creator_credit: Rachel Roberts, Catriona McKenzie and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Max needs to choose between money and love. An old bagman gives Max a magic fishing lure. As colour begins to seep into his life, the choice becomes clear.
Cast features Michael Tuahine, Phaedra Nicolaidis, Nicholas Papademetriou and Tony Barry.

results.title: The Laundry
results.creator_credit: Lesley Dyer, Alex Chomicz and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A big man covered in blood enters a basement laundry. Is the threat in her mind or it real? And which is more scary…?
Cast features Rhonnda Findleton and Domenic Galati.

results.title: Inja = Dog
results.creator_credit: Joe Weatherstone, Steve Pasvolsky and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
South Africa, 1980s. Using a young Xhosa boy as a pawn, a farmer teaches his puppy to be white man’s best friend. Ten years later, both their lives hang in the balance at the mercy of the dog.
Filmed on location at Bien Donne Werf, Franschhoek Valley, South Africa.
In English/Afrikaans/Xhosa with English subtitles

results.title: Harvey
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Rachel Roberts, Priscilla Collins and Peter McDonald
results.brief_description: A dark tale of obsession and loneliness about a man searching for physical and emotional completeness. It is only when he thinks he has achieved this goal through the unwilling coalescence of his neighbour that he begins to understand the painful, irresolvable nature of his obsession. Stars Nicholas Hope as Harvey and Lisa Angove as Lily.
